ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: 1. If my child becomes angry because he/she is sick or hurt and can't go to his/her friend's birthday party, I would: a. send my child to his/her room to cool off
1. If my child becomes angry because he/she is sick or hurt and can't go to his/her friend's birthday party, I would: b. get angry at my child

1. If my child becomes angry because he/she is sick or hurt and can't go to his/her friend's birthday party, I would: c. help my child think about ways that he/she can still be with friends (e.g., invite some friends over after the party)
1. If my child becomes angry because he/she is sick or hurt and can't go to his/her friend's birthday party, I would: d. tell my child not to make a big deal out of missing the party
1. If my child becomes angry because he/she is sick or hurt and can't go to his/her friend's birthday party, I would: e. encourage my child to express his/her feelings of anger and frustration

1. If my child becomes angry because he/she is sick or hurt and can't go to his/her friend's birthday party, I would: f. soothe my child and do something fun with him/her to make him/her feel better about missing the party
2. If my child falls off his/her bike and breaks it, and then gets upset and cries, I would: a. remain calm and not let myself get anxious
2. If my child falls off his/her bike and breaks it, and then gets upset and cries, I would: b. comfort my child and try to get him/her to forget about the accident
2. If my child falls off his/her bike and breaks it, and then gets upset and cries, I would: c. tell my child that he/she is over-reacting
2. If my child falls off his/her bike and breaks it, and then gets upset and cries, I would: d. help my child figure out how to get the bike fixed
2. If my child falls off his/her bike and breaks it, and then gets upset and cries, I would: e. tell my child it's OK to cry
2. If my child falls off his/her bike and breaks it, and then gets upset and cries, I would: f. tell my child to stop crying or he/she won't be allowed to ride his/her bike anytime soon
3. If my child loses some prized possession and reacts with tears, I would: a. get upset with him/her for being so careless and then crying about it
3. If my child loses some prized possession and reacts with tears, I would: b. tell my child that he/she is over-reacting
3. If my child loses some prized possession and reacts with tears, I would: c. help my child think of places he/she hasn't looked yet
3. If my child loses some prized possession and reacts with tears, I would: d. distract my child by talking about happy things
3. If my child loses some prized possession and reacts with tears, I would: e. tell him/her it's OK to cry when you feel unhappy
3. If my child loses some prized possession and reacts with tears, I would: f. tell him/her that's what happens when you're not careful

4. If my child is afraid of injections and becomes quite shaky and teary while waiting for his/her turn to get a shot, I would: a. tell him/her to shape up or he/she won't be allowed to do something he/she likes to do (e.g., watch TV)
4. If my child is afraid of injections and becomes quite shaky and teary while waiting for his/her turn to get a shot, I would: b. encourage my child to talk about his/her fears
4. If my child is afraid of injections and becomes quite shaky and teary while waiting for his/her turn to get a shot, I would: c. tell my child not to make big deal of the shot
4. If my child is afraid of injections and becomes quite shaky and teary while waiting for his/her turn to get a shot, I would: d. tell him/her not to embarrass us by crying
4. If my child is afraid of injections and becomes quite shaky and teary while waiting for his/her turn to get a shot, I would: e. comfort him/her before and after the shot

4. If my child is afraid of injections and becomes quite shaky and teary while waiting for his/her turn to get a shot, I would: f. talk to my child about ways to make it hurt less (such as relaxing so it won't hurt or taking deep breaths).

5. If my child is going over to spend the afternoon at a friend's house and becomes nervous and upset because I can't stay there with him/her, I would: a. distract my child by talking about all the fun he/she will have with his/her friend

5. If my child is going over to spend the afternoon at a friend's house and becomes nervous and upset because I can't stay there with him/her, I would: b. help my child think of things that he/she could do so that being at the friend's house without me wasn't scary (e.g., take a favorite book or toy with him/her)

5. If my child is going over to spend the afternoon at a friend's house and becomes nervous and upset because I can't stay there with him/her, I would: c. tell my child to quit over-reacting and being a baby

5. If my child is going over to spend the afternoon at a friend's house and becomes nervous and upset because I can't stay there with him/her, I would: d. tell the child that if he/she doesn't stop that he/she won't be allowed to go out anymore

5. If my child is going over to spend the afternoon at a friend's house and becomes nervous and upset because I can't stay there with him/her, I would: e. feel upset and uncomfortable because of my child's reactions

5. If my child is going over to spend the afternoon at a friend's house and becomes nervous and upset because I can't stay there with him/her, I would: f. encourage my child to talk about his/her nervous feelings

6. If my child is participating in some group activity with his/her friends and proceeds to make a mistake and then looks embarrassed and on the verge of tears, I would: a. comfort my child and try to make him/her feel better

6. If my child is participating in some group activity with his/her friends and proceeds to make a mistake and then looks embarrassed and on the verge of tears, I would: b. tell my child that he/she is over-reacting

6. If my child is participating in some group activity with his/her friends and proceeds to make a mistake and then looks embarrassed and on the verge of tears, I would: c. feel uncomfortable and embarrassed myself

6. If my child is participating in some group activity with his/her friends and proceeds to make a mistake and then looks embarrassed and on the verge of tears, I would: d. tell my child to straighten up or we'll go home right away

6. If my child is participating in some group activity with his/her friends and proceeds to make a mistake and then looks embarrassed and on the verge of tears, I would: e. encourage my child to talk about his/her feelings of embarrassment

6. If my child is participating in some group activity with his/her friends and proceeds to make a mistake and then looks embarrassed and on the verge of tears, I would: f. tell my child that I'll help him/her practice so that he/she can do better next time

7. If my child is about to appear in a recital or sports activity and becomes visibly nervous about people watching him/her, I would: a. help my child think of things that he/she could do to get ready for his/her turn (e.g., to do some warm-ups and not to look at the audience)

7. If my child is about to appear in a recital or sports activity and becomes visibly nervous about people watching him/her, I would: b. suggest that my child think about something relaxing so that his/her nervousness will go away
7. If my child is about to appear in a recital or sports activity and becomes visibly nervous about people watching him/her, I would: c. remain calm and not get nervous myself
7. If my child is about to appear in a recital or sports activity and becomes visibly nervous about people watching him/her, I would: d. tell my child that he/she is being a baby about it

7. If my child is about to appear in a recital or sports activity and becomes visibly nervous about people watching him/her, I would: e. tell my child that if he/she doesn't calm down, we'll have to leave and go home right away
7. If my child is about to appear in a recital or sports activity and becomes visibly nervous about people watching him/her, I would: f. encourage my child to talk about his/her nervous feelings

8. If my child receives an undesirable birthday gift from a friend and looks obviously disappointed, even annoyed, after opening it in the presence of the friend, I would: a. encourage my child to express his/her disappointed feelings

8. If my child receives an undesirable birthday gift from a friend and looks obviously disappointed, even annoyed, after opening it in the presence of the friend, I would: b. tell my child that the present can be exchanged for something the child wants

8. If my child receives an undesirable birthday gift from a friend and looks obviously disappointed, even annoyed, after opening it in the presence of the friend, I would: c. NOT be annoyed with my child for being rude

8. If my child receives an undesirable birthday gift from a friend and looks obviously disappointed, even annoyed, after opening it in the presence of the friend, I would: d. tell my child that he/she is over-reacting

8. If my child receives an undesirable birthday gift from a friend and looks obviously disappointed, even annoyed, after opening it in the presence of the friend, I would: e. scold my child for being insensitive to the friend's feelings

8. If my child receives an undesirable birthday gift from a friend and looks obviously disappointed, even annoyed, after opening it in the presence of the friend, I would: f. try to get my child to feel better by doing something fun
9. If my child is panicky and can't go to sleep after watching a scary TV show, I would: a. encourage my child to talk about what scared him/her
9. If my child is panicky and can't go to sleep after watching a scary TV show, I would: b. get upset with him/her for being silly
9. If my child is panicky and can't go to sleep after watching a scary TV show, I would: c. tell my child that he/she is over-reacting

9. If my child is panicky and can't go to sleep after watching a scary TV show, I would: d. help my child think of something to do so that he/she can get to sleep (e.g., take a toy to bed, leave the lights on)
9. If my child is panicky and can't go to sleep after watching a scary TV show, I would: e. tell him/her to go to bed or he/she won't be allowed to watch any more TV
9. If my child is panicky and can't go to sleep after watching a scary TV show, I would: f. do something fun with my child to help him/her forget about what scared him/her
10. If my child is at a park and appears on the verge of tears because the other children are mean to him/her and won't let him/her play with them, I would: a. NOT get upset myself

10. If my child is at a park and appears on the verge of tears because the other children are mean to him/her and won't let him/her play with them, I would: b. tell my child that if he/she starts crying then we'll have to go home right away

10. If my child is at a park and appears on the verge of tears because the other children are mean to him/her and won't let him/her play with them, I would: c. tell my child it's OK to cry when he/she feels bad

10. If my child is at a park and appears on the verge of tears because the other children are mean to him/her and won't let him/her play with them, I would: d. comfort my child and try to get him/her to think about something happy

10. If my child is at a park and appears on the verge of tears because the other children are mean to him/her and won't let him/her play with them, I would: e. help my child think of something else to do

10. If my child is at a park and appears on the verge of tears because the other children are mean to him/her and won't let him/her play with them, I would: f. tell my child that he/she will feel better soon
11. If my child is playing with other children and one of them calls him/her names, and my child then begins to tremble and become tearful, I would: a. tell my child not to make a big deal out of it
11. If my child is playing with other children and one of them calls him/her names, and my child then begins to tremble and become tearful, I would: b. feel upset myself

11. If my child is playing with other children and one of them calls him/her names, and my child then begins to tremble and become tearful, I would: c. tell my child to behave or we'll have to go home right away

11. If my child is playing with other children and one of them calls him/her names, and my child then begins to tremble and become tearful, I would: d. help my child think of constructive things to do when other children tease him/her (e.g., find other things to do)

11. If my child is playing with other children and one of them calls him/her names, and my child then begins to tremble and become tearful, I would: e. comfort him/her and play a game to take his/her mind off the upsetting event

11. If my child is playing with other children and one of them calls him/her names, and my child then begins to tremble and become tearful, I would: f. encourage him/her to talk about how it hurts to be teased

12. If my child is shy and scared around strangers and consistently becomes teary and wants to stay in his/her bedroom whenever family friends come to visit, I would: a. help my child think of things to do that would make meeting my friends less scary (e.g., to take a favorite toy with him/her when meeting my friends)

12. If my child is shy and scared around strangers and consistently becomes teary and wants to stay in his/her bedroom whenever family friends come to visit, I would: b. tell my child that it is OK to feel nervous

12. If my child is shy and scared around strangers and consistently becomes teary and wants to stay in his/her bedroom whenever family friends come to visit, I would: c. try to make my child happy by talking about the fun things we can do with our friends

12. If my child is shy and scared around strangers and consistently becomes teary and wants to stay in his/her bedroom whenever family friends come to visit, I would: d. feel upset and uncomfortable because of my child's reactions

12. If my child is shy and scared around strangers and consistently becomes teary and wants to stay in his/her bedroom whenever family friends come to visit, I would: e. tell my child that he/she must stay in the living room and visit with our friends

12. If my child is shy and scared around strangers and consistently becomes teary and wants to stay in his/her bedroom whenever family friends come to visit, I would: f. tell my child that he/she is being a baby
